channel.title: Strictly Untyped
channel.description: A podcast about technology and programming but not strictly limited to those two.
channel.itunes:subtitle: A podcast about technology and programming but no…
channel.itunes:author: Ramón Argüello & Pascal Hartig

item.title: 1: Android vs. iOS
item.itunes:author: Ramón Argüello & Pascal Hartig
item.itunes:summary:
For their first real episode, Ramón and Passy talk about some of the latest news in tech and address the elephant in the room: Android vs iOS from a DX (Developer Experience) perspective.
## Follow-Up
* Talking about podcasts on podcasts: https://overcast.fm/+EtBoIE-HU/7:21
## Other Topics
* Apple open sourcing Swift: https://github.com/apple/swift * Dropbox shutting down Mailbox + Carousel: https://blogs.dropbox.com/dropbox/2015/12/saying-goodbye-to-carousel-and-mailbox/ * Apple's new gorgeous iPhone battery case: http://www.apple.com/shop/product/MGQM2LL/A/iphone-6s-smart-battery-case-white * Apple May Replace 3.5mm Headphone Jack on iPhone 7 With All-in-One Lightning Connector: http://www.macrumors.com/2015/11/27/iphone-7-no-3-5mm-headphone-jack-lightning/ * Google Play Store will soon display if an app contains ads: http://www.techtimes.com/articles/108538/20151120/google-play-store-will-soon-warn-users-if-apps-have-ads.htm
## Links
* Android Needs A Simulator by Jake Wharton: http://jakewharton.com/android-needs-a-simulator/
## About
* Ramón Argüello: https://twitter.com/monchote * Pascal Hartig: https://twitter.com/passy * Strictly Untyped: https://twitter.com/strictlyuntyped

For their first real episode, Ramón and Passy talk about some of the latest news in tech and address the elephant in the room: Android vs iOS from a DX (Developer Experience) perspective.

item.title: 0: Introductions
item.itunes:author: Ramón Argüello & Pascal Hartig
item.itunes:summary:
Pascal Hartig (@passy) and Ramón Argüello (@monchote) are the hosts of this new podcast about technology, programming, audiovisual entertainment and any other topic that comes up while recording.
In this episode they'd like to take 10 minutes of your time to introduce themselves.
Find more about Stricly Untyped at: https://twitter.com/strictlyuntyped
